refsect2.title: enum gnutls_certificate_import_flags
refsect2.para: Enumeration of different certificate import flags.

listitem.simpara: Fail if the certificates in the buffer are more than the space allocated for certificates. The error code will be GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER.
Fail if the certificates in the buffer are not ordered starting from subject to issuer. The error code will be GNUTLS_E_CERTIFICATE_LIST_UNSORTED.

refsect2.title: enum gnutls_certificate_verify_flags
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GNUTLS_VERIFY_DISABLE_CA_SIGN = 1<<0, GNUTLS_VERIFY_ALLOW_X509_V1_CA_CRT = 1<<1, GNUTLS_VERIFY_DO_NOT_ALLOW_SAME = 1<<2, GNUTLS_VERIFY_ALLOW_ANY_X509_V1_CA_CRT = 1<<3, GNUTLS_VERIFY_ALLOW_SIGN_RSA_MD2 = 1<<4, GNUTLS_VERIFY_ALLOW_SIGN_RSA_MD5 = 1<<5, GNUTLS_VERIFY_DISABLE_TIME_CHECKS = 1<<6, GNUTLS_VERIFY_DISABLE_TRUSTED_TIME_CHECKS = 1<<7, GNUTLS_VERIFY_DO_NOT_ALLOW_X509_V1_CA_CRT = 1<<8, GNUTLS_VERIFY_DISABLE_CRL_CHECKS = 1<<9, GNUTLS_VERIFY_ALLOW_UNSORTED_CHAIN = 1<<10, GNUTLS_VERIFY_DO_NOT_ALLOW_UNSORTED_CHAIN = 1<<11, } gnutls_certificate_verify_flags;
refsect2.para: Enumeration of different certificate verify flags.

listitem.simpara: If set a signer does not have to be a certificate authority. This flag should normaly be disabled, unless you know what this means.

Allow trusted CA certicates with version 1. This is safer than GNUTLS_VERIFY_ALLOW_ANY_X509_V1_CA_CRT, and should be used instead. That way only signers in your trusted list will be allowed to have certicates of version 1. This is the default.
If a certificate is not signed by anyone trusted but exists in the trusted CA list do not treat it as trusted.

Allow CA certificates that have version 1 (both root and intermediate). This might be dangerous since those haven't the basicConstraints extension. Must be used in combination with GNUTLS_VERIFY_ALLOW_X509_V1_CA_CRT.
Allow certificates to be signed using the broken MD2 algorithm.
Allow certificates to be signed using the broken MD5 algorithm.
Disable checking of activation and expiration validity periods of certificate chains. Don't set this unless you understand the security implications.
If set a signer in the trusted list is never checked for expiration or activation.
Do not allow trusted CA certificates that have version 1. This option is to be used to deprecate all certificates of version 1.
Disable checking for validity using certificate revocation lists or the available OCSP data.
A certificate chain is tolerated if unsorted (the case with many TLS servers out there). This is the default since GnuTLS 3.1.4.
Do not tolerate an unsorted certificate chain.

refsect2.title: enum gnutls_info_access_what_t
refsect2.para: Enumeration of types for the what parameter of gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_info_access().

listitem.simpara: Get accessMethod OID.
Get accessLocation name type.
Get accessLocation URI value.
get accessLocation URI value for OCSP.
get accessLocation URI value for caIssuers.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_pkcs7_deinit (gnutls_pkcs7_t pkcs7);
refsect2.para: This function will deinitialize a PKCS7 structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_delete_crl ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_pkcs7_delete_crl (gnutls_pkcs7_t pkcs7, int indx);
refsect2.para: This function will delete a crl from a PKCS7 or RFC2630 crl set. Index starts from 0. Returns 0 on success.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_pkcs7_t structure
the index of the crl to delete
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_delete_crt ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_pkcs7_delete_crt (gnutls_pkcs7_t pkcs7, int indx);
refsect2.para: This function will delete a certificate from a PKCS7 or RFC2630 certificate set. Index starts from 0. Returns 0 on success.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_pkcs7_t structure
the index of the certificate to delete
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_pkcs7_export (gnutls_pkcs7_t pkcs7, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the pkcs7 structure to DER or PEM format.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN PKCS7".

listitem.simpara: Holds the pkcs7 structure
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a structure PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: This function will export the pkcs7 structure to DER or PEM format.
The output buffer is allocated using gnutls_malloc().
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN PKCS7".

listitem.simpara: Holds the pkcs7 structure
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a structure PEM or DER encoded
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_get_crl_count ()

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_get_crl_raw ()

refsect2.para: This function will return a crl of the PKCS7 or RFC2630 crl set.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_pkcs7_t structure
contains the index of the crl to extract
the contents of the crl will be copied there (may be null)
should hold the size of the crl

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. If the provided buffer is not long enough, then crl_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned. After the last crl has been read GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_get_crt_count ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_pkcs7_get_crt_count (gnutls_pkcs7_t pkcs7);

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_pkcs7_t structure
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: This function will return a certificate of the PKCS7 or RFC2630 certificate set.
After the last certificate has been read GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_pkcs7_t structure
contains the index of the certificate to extract
the contents of the certificate will be copied there (may be null)
should hold the size of the certificate

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. If the provided buffer is not long enough, then certificate_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned.

If the PKCS7 is PEM encoded it should have a header of "PKCS7".

refsect2.title: enum gnutls_pkcs_encrypt_flags_t
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GNUTLS_PKCS_PLAIN = 1, GNUTLS_PKCS_USE_PKCS12_3DES = 2, GNUTLS_PKCS_USE_PKCS12_ARCFOUR = 4, GNUTLS_PKCS_USE_PKCS12_RC2_40 = 8, GNUTLS_PKCS_USE_PBES2_3DES = 16, GNUTLS_PKCS_USE_PBES2_AES_128 = 32, GNUTLS_PKCS_USE_PBES2_AES_192 = 64, GNUTLS_PKCS_USE_PBES2_AES_256 = 128, GNUTLS_PKCS_NULL_PASSWORD = 256 } gnutls_pkcs_encrypt_flags_t;
refsect2.para: Enumeration of different PKCS encryption flags.

listitem.simpara: Unencrypted private key.
PKCS-12 3DES.
PKCS-12 ARCFOUR.
PKCS-12 RC2-40.
PBES2 3DES.
PBES2 AES-128.
PBES2 AES-192.
PBES2 AES-256.
Some schemas distinguish between an empty and a NULL password.

is the certificate of a possible issuer
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: This function will export the revocation list to DER or PEM format.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.

the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.

If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN X509 CRL".

the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a private key PEM or DER encoded
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative error code on failure. Since 3.1.3

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_authority_key_gn_serial ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_authority_key_gn_serial (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, unsigned int seq, void *alt, size_t *alt_size, unsigned int *alt_type, void *serial, size_t *serial_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the X.509 authority key identifier when stored as a general name (authorityCertIssuer) and serial number.
Because more than one general names might be stored seq can be used as a counter to request them all until GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of alt.
holds the type of the alternative name (one of gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t).
buffer to store the serial number (may be null)
Holds the size of the serial field (may be null)
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
Returns 0 on success, or an error code.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_authority_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_authority_key_id (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, void *id, size_t *id_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the CRL authority's key identifier. This is obtained by the X.509 Authority Key identifier extension field (2.5.29.35). Note that this function only returns the keyIdentifier field of the extension and GNUTLS_E_X509_UNSUPPORTED_EXTENSION, if the extension contains the name and serial number of the certificate. In that case gnutls_x509_crl_get_authority_key_gn_serial() may be used.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The place where the identifier will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate
refsect2.programlisting: #define gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_serial

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate_count
refsect2.programlisting: #define gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate_count gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_count

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_count ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_count (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will return the number of revoked certificates in the given CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
number of certificates, a negative error code on failure.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_serial ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_serial (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, unsigned char *serial, size_t *serial_size, time_t *t);
refsect2.para: This function will retrieve the serial number of the specified, by the index, revoked certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
the index of the certificate to extract (starting from 0)
where the serial number will be copied
initially holds the size of serial
if non null, will hold the time this certificate was revoked
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_dn_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_dn_oid (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the requested OID of the name of the CRL issuer, specified by the given index.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which DN OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of 'oid'
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the sizeof_oid will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_data (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *data, size_t *sizeof_data);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension data in the CRL. The extension data will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

Use gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_info() to extract the OID and critical flag. Use gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_info() instead, if you want to get data indexed by the extension OID rather than sequence.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the data (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_info (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the CRL, and the critical flag for it. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer. Use gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_data() to extract the data.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *sizeof_oid is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send, use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID
initially holds the maximum size of oid, on return holds actual size of oid.
output variable with critical flag, may be NULL.

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_oid (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the CRL. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send, use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_issuer_dn ()
refsect2.para: This function will copy the name of the CRL issuer in the provided buffer. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC4514. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.
If buf is NULL then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_issuer_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_issuer_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the part of the name of the CRL issuer specified by the given OID. The output will be encoded as described in RFC4514. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h If raw flag is (0), this function will only return known OIDs as text. Other OIDs will be DER encoded, as described in RFC4514 -- in hex format with a '#' prefix. You can check about known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known().
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN, this specifies which to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
If non-zero returns the raw DER data of the DN part.
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_next_update ()
refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crl_get_next_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will return the time the next CRL will be issued. This field is optional in a CRL so it might be normal to get an error instead.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
when the next CRL will be issued, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_number ()

The place where the number will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_raw_issuer_dn ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_raw_issuer_dn (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, gnutls_datum_t *dn);
refsect2.para: This function will return a pointer to the DER encoded DN structure and the length.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
will hold the starting point of the DN
a negative error code on error, and (0) on success.

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative error code on error.

refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crl_get_this_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);

when the CRL was issued, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_version (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_import ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded CRL to the native gnutls_x509_crl_t format. The output will be stored in 'crl'.
If the CRL is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CRL".

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed CRL.
The DER or PEM encoded CRL.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_init (gnutls_x509_crl_t *crl);
refsect2.para: This function will initialize a CRL structure. CRL stands for Certificate Revocation List. A revocation list usually contains lists of certificate serial numbers that have been revoked by an Authority. The revocation lists are always signed with the authority's private key.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_list_import ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_list_import (gnutls_x509_crl_t *crls, unsigned int *crl_max, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given PEM encoded CRL list to the native gnutls_x509_crl_t format. The output will be stored in crls. They will be automatically initialized.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CRL".

listitem.simpara: The structures to store the parsed CRLs. Must not be initialized.
Initially must hold the maximum number of crls. It will be updated with the number of crls available.
The PEM encoded CRLs
One of DER or PEM.
must be (0) or an OR'd sequence of gnutls_certificate_import_flags.
the number of certificates read or a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_list_import2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_list_import2 (gnutls_x509_crl_t **crls, unsigned int *size, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given PEM encoded CRL list to the native gnutls_x509_crl_t format. The output will be stored in crls. They will be automatically initialized.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CRL".

listitem.simpara: The structures to store the parsed crl list. Must not be initialized.
It will contain the size of the list.
The PEM encoded CRL.
One of DER or PEM.
must be (0) or an OR'd sequence of gnutls_certificate_import_flags.
the number of certificates read or a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_print ()
refsect2.para: This function will pretty print a X.509 certificate revocation list, suitable for display to a human.
The output out needs to be deallocated using gnutls_free().

listitem.simpara: The structure to be printed
Indicate the format to use
Newly allocated datum with (0) terminated string.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: enum gnutls_x509_crl_reason_flags_t
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_UNSPECIFIED=0, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_PRIVILEGE_WITHDRAWN=1, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_CERTIFICATE_HOLD=2, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_CESSATION_OF_OPERATION=4, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_SUPERSEDED=8, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_AFFILIATION_CHANGED=16, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_CA_COMPROMISE=32, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_KEY_COMPROMISE=64, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_UNUSED=128, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_AA_COMPROMISE=32768 } gnutls_x509_crl_reason_flags_t;
refsect2.para: Enumeration of types for the CRL revocation reasons.

listitem.simpara: The privileges were withdrawn from the owner.
The certificate is on hold.
The end-entity is no longer operating.
There is a newer certificate of the owner.
The end-entity affiliation has changed.
The CA was compromised.
The certificate's key was compromised.
The key was never used.
AA compromised.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_authority_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_authority_key_id (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const void *id, size_t id_size);
refsect2.para: This function will set the CRL's authority key ID extension. Only the keyIdentifier field can be set with this function. This may be used by an authority that holds multiple private keys, to distinguish the used key.

listitem.simpara: a CRL of type gnutls_x509_crl_t
The key ID
Holds the size of the serial field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_crt ()
refsect2.para: This function will set a revoked certificate's serial number to the CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t with the revoked certificate
The time this certificate was revoked
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_crt_serial ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_crt_serial (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const void *serial, size_t serial_size, time_t revocation_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set a revoked certificate's serial number to the CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The revoked certificate's serial number
Holds the size of the serial field.
The time this certificate was revoked
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_next_update ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_next_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, time_t exp_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set the time this CRL will be updated.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_number ()
refsect2.para: This function will set the CRL's number extension. This is to be used as a unique and monotonic number assigned to the CRL by the authority.

listitem.simpara: a CRL of type gnutls_x509_crl_t
The CRL number
Holds the size of the nr field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_this_update ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_this_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, time_t act_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set the time this CRL was issued.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_version (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, unsigned int version);
refsect2.para: This function will set the version of the CRL. This must be one for CRL version 1, and so on. The CRLs generated by gnutls should have a version number of 2.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
holds the version number. For CRLv1 crls must be 1.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_sign2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_sign2 (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, gnutls_x509_crt_t issuer, gnutls_x509_privkey_t issuer_key, gnutls_digest_algorithm_t dig, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will sign the CRL with the issuer's private key, and will copy the issuer's information into the CRL.
This must be the last step in a certificate CRL since all the previously set parameters are now signed.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
is the certificate of the certificate issuer
holds the issuer's private key
The message digest to use. GNUTLS_DIG_SHA1 is the safe choice unless you know what you're doing.
must be 0
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_verify ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_verify (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const gnutls_x509_crt_t *CA_list, int CA_list_length, unsigned int flags, unsigned int *verify);
refsect2.para: This function will try to verify the given crl and return its status. See gnutls_x509_crt_list_verify() for a detailed description of return values. Note that since GnuTLS 3.1.4 this function includes the time checks.

listitem.simpara: is the crl to be verified
is a certificate list that is considered to be trusted one
holds the number of CA certificates in CA_list
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
will hold the crl verification output.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_crq_deinit (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq);
refsect2.para: This function will deinitialize a PKCS10 certificate request structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_export (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the certificate request to a PEM or DER encoded PKCS10 structure.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned and *output_data_size will be updated.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN NEW CERTIFICATE REQUEST".

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a certificate request PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_export2 ()
refsect2.para: This function will export the certificate request to a PEM or DER encoded PKCS10 structure.
The output buffer is allocated using gnutls_malloc().
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN NEW CERTIFICATE REQUEST".

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a certificate request PEM or DER encoded
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. Since 3.1.3

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, const char *oid, int indx, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will return the attribute in the certificate request specified by the given Object ID. The attribute will be DER encoded.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds an Object Identified in (0)-terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the attribute list, this specifies which to send, use (0) to get the first one
a pointer to a structure to hold the attribute data (may be NULL)
initially holds the size of buf
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_data (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, int indx, void *data, size_t *sizeof_data);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested attribute data in the certificate request. The attribute data will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.
Use gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_info() to extract the OID. Use gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_by_oid() instead, if you want to get data indexed by the attribute OID rather than sequence.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
Specifies which attribute OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the data (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_info (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested attribute OID in the certificate, and the critical flag for it. The attribute OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer. Use gnutls_x509_crq_get_attribute_data() to extract the data.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *sizeof_oid is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
Specifies which attribute OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID
initially holds the maximum size of oid, on return holds actual size of oid.

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_basic_constraints ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_basic_constraints (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int *critical, unsigned int *ca, int *pathlen);
refsect2.para: This function will read the certificate's basic constraints, and return the certificates CA status. It reads the basicConstraints X.509 extension (2.5.29.19).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
pointer to output integer indicating CA status, may be NULL, value is 1 if the certificate CA flag is set, 0 otherwise.
pointer to output integer indicating path length (may be NULL), non-negative error codes indicate a present pathLenConstraint field and the actual value, -1 indicate that the field is absent.

If the certificate is a CA a positive value will be returned, or (0) if the certificate does not have CA flag set. A negative error code may be returned in case of errors. If the certificate does not contain the basicConstraints extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_challenge_password ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_challenge_password (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, char *pass, size_t *sizeof_pass);
refsect2.para: This function will return the challenge password in the request. The challenge password is intended to be used for requesting a revocation of the certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
will hold a (0)-terminated password string
Initially holds the size of pass.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_dn ()
refsect2.para: This function will copy the name of the Certificate request subject to the provided buffer. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC 2253. The output string buf will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be NULL)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the part of the name of the Certificate request subject, specified by the given OID. The output will be encoded as described in RFC2253. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h If raw flag is (0), this function will only return known OIDs as text. Other OIDs will be DER encoded, as described in RFC2253 -- in hex format with a '#' prefix. You can check about known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known().

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN, this specifies which to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
If non-zero returns the raw DER data of the DN part.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be NULL)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_dn_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_dn_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the requested OID of the name of the certificate request subject, specified by the given index.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
Specifies which DN OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be NULL)
initially holds the size of oid
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_oid will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, const char *oid, int indx, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the extension specified by the OID in the certificate. The extensions will be returned as binary data DER encoded, in the provided buffer.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the extensions, this specifies which to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If the certificate does not contain the specified extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_data (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, int indx, void *data, size_t *sizeof_data);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension data in the certificate. The extension data will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

Use gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_info() to extract the OID and critical flag. Use gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_by_oid() instead, if you want to get data indexed by the extension OID rather than sequence.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the data (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_info (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the certificate, and the critical flag for it. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer. Use gnutls_x509_crq_get_extension_data() to extract the data.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *sizeof_oid is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID
initially holds the maximum size of oid, on return holds actual size of oid.
output variable with critical flag, may be NULL.

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_key_id (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int flags, unsigned char *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will return a unique ID that depends on the public key parameters. This ID can be used in checking whether a certificate corresponds to the given private key.

If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned. The output will normally be a SHA-1 hash output, which is 20 bytes.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crq_t
should be 0 for now
will contain the key ID
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
In case of failure a negative error code will be returned, and 0 on success.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_key_purpose_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_key_purpose_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the key purpose OIDs of the Certificate specified by the given index. These are stored in the Extended Key Usage extension (2.5.29.37). See the GNUTLS_KP_* definitions for human readable names.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
This specifies which OID to return, use (0) to get the first one
a pointer to a buffer to hold the OID (may be NULL)
initially holds the size of oid
output variable with critical flag, may be NULL.
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_oid will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_key_rsa_raw ()
refsect2.para: This function will export the RSA public key's parameters found in the given structure. The new parameters will be allocated using gnutls_malloc() and will be stored in the appropriate datum.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
will hold the modulus
will hold the public exponent
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_key_usage ()
refsect2.para: This function will return certificate's key usage, by reading the keyUsage X.509 extension (2.5.29.15). The key usage value will ORed values of the: GNUTLS_KEY_DIGITAL_SIGNATURE, GNUTLS_KEY_NON_REPUDIATION, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_ENCIPHERMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_DATA_ENCIPHERMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_AGREEMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_CERT_SIGN, GNUTLS_KEY_CRL_SIGN, GNUTLS_KEY_ENCIPHER_ONLY, GNUTLS_KEY_DECIPHER_ONLY.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
where the key usage bits will be stored
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
the certificate key usage, or a negative error code in case of parsing error. If the certificate does not contain the keyUsage extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_pk_algorithm ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_pk_algorithm (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int *bits);
refsect2.para: This function will return the public key algorithm of a PKCS10 certificate request.
If bits is non-NULL, it should have enough size to hold the parameters size in bits. For RSA the bits returned is the modulus. For DSA the bits returned are of the public exponent.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
if bits is non-NULL it will hold the size of the parameters' in bits
a member of the gnutls_pk_algorithm_t enumeration on success, or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_private_key_usage_period ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_private_key_usage_period (gnutls_x509_crq_t cert, time_t *activation, time_t *expiration, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the expiration and activation times of the private key of the certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
The activation time
The expiration time
the extension status
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if the extension is not present, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_subject_alt_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_subject_alt_name (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *ret_type, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the alternative names, contained in the given certificate. It is the same as gnutls_x509_crq_get_subject_alt_name() except for the fact that it will return the type of the alternative name in ret_type even if the function fails for some reason (i.e. the buffer provided is not enough).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name, 0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of ret.
holds the gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t name type
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ret_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ret_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate request does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_subject_alt_othername_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_subject_alt_othername_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the type OID of an otherName Subject Alternative Name, contained in the given certificate, and return the type as an enumerated element.
This function is only useful if gnutls_x509_crq_get_subject_alt_name() returned GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the otherName OID will be copied to
holds the size of ret.

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. For supported OIDs, it will return one of the virtual (GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_*) types, e.g. GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_XMPP, and GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME for unknown OIDs. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ret_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ret_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number and with the otherName type then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_get_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_get_version (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq);
refsect2.para: This function will return the version of the specified Certificate request.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
version of certificate request, or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_import ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded certificate request to a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure. The output will be stored in crq.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "NEW CERTIFICATE REQUEST".

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed certificate request.
The DER or PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_init (gnutls_x509_crq_t *crq);
refsect2.para: This function will initialize a PKCS10 certificate request structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_print ()
refsect2.para: This function will pretty print a certificate request, suitable for display to a human.
The output out needs to be deallocated using gnutls_free().

listitem.simpara: The structure to be printed
Indicate the format to use
Newly allocated datum with (0) terminated string.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_attribute_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_attribute_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, const char *oid, void *buf, size_t sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will set the attribute in the certificate request specified by the given Object ID. The attribute must be be DER encoded.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds an Object Identified in (0)-terminated string
a pointer to a structure that holds the attribute data
holds the size of buf
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_basic_constraints ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_basic_constraints (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int ca, int pathLenConstraint);
refsect2.para: This function will set the basicConstraints certificate extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate request of type gnutls_x509_crq_t
true(1) or false(0) depending on the Certificate authority status.
non-negative error codes indicate maximum length of path, and negative error codes indicate that the pathLenConstraints field should not be present.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_challenge_password ()
refsect2.para: This function will set a challenge password to be used when revoking the request.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds a (0)-terminated password
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, const char *oid, unsigned int raw_flag, const void *data, unsigned int sizeof_data);
refsect2.para: This function will set the part of the name of the Certificate request subject, specified by the given OID. The input string should be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h With this function you can only set the known OIDs. You can test for known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known(). For OIDs that are not known (by gnutls) you should properly DER encode your data, and call this function with raw_flag set.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds an Object Identifier in a (0)-terminated string
must be 0, or 1 if the data are DER encoded
a pointer to the input data
holds the size of data
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_key ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_key (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, gnutls_x509_privkey_t key);
refsect2.para: This function will set the public parameters from the given private key to the request.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds a private key
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_key_purpose_oid ()
refsect2.para: This function will set the key purpose OIDs of the Certificate. These are stored in the Extended Key Usage extension (2.5.29.37) See the GNUTLS_KP_* definitions for human readable names.
Subsequent calls to this function will append OIDs to the OID list.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crq_t
a pointer to a (0)-terminated string that holds the OID
Whether this extension will be critical or not
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_key_rsa_raw ()
refsect2.para: This function will set the public parameters from the given private key to the request. Only RSA keys are currently supported.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds the modulus
holds the public exponent
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_key_usage ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_key_usage (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int usage);
refsect2.para: This function will set the keyUsage certificate extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate request of type gnutls_x509_crq_t
an ORed sequence of the GNUTLS_KEY_* elements.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_private_key_usage_period ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_private_key_usage_period (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, time_t activation, time_t expiration);
refsect2.para: This function will set the private key usage period extension (2.5.29.16).

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crq_t
The activation time
The expiration time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_subject_alt_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_subject_alt_name (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t nt, const void *data, unsigned int data_size, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will set the subject alternative name certificate extension. It can set the following types:
GNUTLS_SAN_DNSNAME: as a text string
GNUTLS_SAN_RFC822NAME: as a text string
GNUTLS_SAN_URI: as a text string
GNUTLS_SAN_IPADDRESS: as a binary IP address (4 or 16 bytes)
Other values can be set as binary values with the proper DER encoding.

listitem.simpara: a certificate request of type gnutls_x509_crq_t
is one of the gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t enumerations
The data to be set
The size of data to be set
GNUTLS_FSAN_SET to clear previous data or GNUTLS_FSAN_APPEND to append.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_set_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_set_version (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int version);
refsect2.para: This function will set the version of the certificate request. For version 1 requests this must be one.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds the version number, for v1 Requests must be 1
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_sign2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_sign2 (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, gnutls_digest_algorithm_t dig, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will sign the certificate request with a private key. This must be the same key as the one used in gnutls_x509_crt_set_key() since a certificate request is self signed.
This must be the last step in a certificate request generation since all the previously set parameters are now signed.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crq_t structure
holds a private key
The message digest to use, i.e., GNUTLS_DIG_SHA1
must be 0

GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, otherwise a negative error code. GNUTLS_E_ASN1_VALUE_NOT_FOUND is returned if you didn't set all information in the certificate request (e.g., the version using gnutls_x509_crq_set_version()).

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crq_verify ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crq_verify (gnutls_x509_crq_t crq, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will verify self signature in the certificate request and return its status.

listitem.simpara: is the crq to be verified
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
In case of a verification failure GNUTLS_E_PK_SIG_VERIFY_FAILED is returned, and zero or positive code on success. Since 2.12.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_check_hostname ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_check_hostname (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *hostname);
refsect2.para: This function will check if the given certificate's subject matches the given hostname. This is a basic implementation of the matching described in RFC2818 (HTTPS), which takes into account wildcards, and the DNSName/IPAddress subject alternative name PKIX extension.

listitem.simpara: should contain an gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
A null terminated string that contains a DNS name
non-zero for a successful match, and zero on failure.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_check_issuer ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_check_issuer (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_crt_t issuer);
refsect2.para: This function will check if the given certificate was issued by the given issuer. It checks the DN fields and the authority key identifier and subject key identifier fields match.

listitem.simpara: is the certificate to be checked
is the certificate of a possible issuer
It will return true (1) if the given certificate is issued by the given issuer, and false (0) if not. A negative error code is returned in case of an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_check_revocation ()
refsect2.para: This function will return check if the given certificate is revoked. It is assumed that the CRLs have been verified before.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
should contain a list of gnutls_x509_crl_t structures
the length of the crl_list
0 if the certificate is NOT revoked, and 1 if it is. A negative error code is returned on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_cpy_crl_dist_points ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_cpy_crl_dist_points (gnutls_x509_crt_t dst, gnutls_x509_crt_t src);
refsect2.para: This function will copy the CRL distribution points certificate extension, from the source to the destination certificate. This may be useful to copy from a CA certificate to issued ones.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
the certificate where the dist points will be copied from
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_crt_deinit (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will deinitialize a certificate structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be deinitialized

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_export (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the certificate to DER or PEM format.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a certificate PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
In case of failure a negative error code will be returned, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_export2 ()
refsect2.para: This function will export the certificate to DER or PEM format. The output buffer is allocated using gnutls_malloc().
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a certificate PEM or DER encoded
In case of failure a negative error code will be returned, and 0 on success.

refsect2.para: Since 3.1

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_activation_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crt_get_activation_time (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will return the time this Certificate was or will be activated.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
activation time, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_info_access ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_info_access (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int seq, int what, gnutls_datum_t *data, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function extracts the Authority Information Access (AIA) extension, see RFC 5280 section 4.2.2.1 for more information. The AIA extension holds a sequence of AccessDescription (AD) data:

The seq input parameter is used to indicate which member of the sequence the caller is interested in. The first member is 0, the second member 1 and so on. When the seq value is out of bounds, GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.
The type of data returned in data is specified via what which should be gnutls_info_access_what_t values.
If what is GNUTLS_IA_ACCESSMETHOD_OID then data will hold the accessMethod OID (e.g., "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.48.1").
If what is GNUTLS_IA_ACCESSLOCATION_GENERALNAME_TYPE, data will hold the accessLocation GeneralName type (e.g., "uniformResourceIdentifier").
If what is GNUTLS_IA_URI, data will hold the accessLocation URI data. Requesting this what value leads to an error if the accessLocation is not of the "uniformResourceIdentifier" type.

If what is GNUTLS_IA_OCSP_URI, data will hold the OCSP URI. Requesting this what value leads to an error if the accessMethod is not 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.48.1 aka OSCP, or if accessLocation is not of the "uniformResourceIdentifier" type.

If what is GNUTLS_IA_CAISSUERS_URI, data will hold the caIssuers URI. Requesting this what value leads to an error if the accessMethod is not 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.48.2 aka caIssuers, or if accessLocation is not of the "uniformResourceIdentifier" type.
More what values may be allocated in the future as needed.
If data is NULL, the function does the same without storing the output data, that is, it will set critical and do error checking as usual.
The value of the critical flag is returned in *critical. Supply a NULL critical if you want the function to make sure the extension is non-critical, as required by RFC 5280.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
specifies the sequence number of the access descriptor (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
what data to get, a gnutls_info_access_what_t type.
output data to be freed with gnutls_free().
pointer to output integer that is set to non-0 if the extension is marked as critical (may be NULL)

GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, GNUTLS_E_INVALID_REQUEST on invalid crt, GNUTLS_E_CONSTRAINT_ERROR if the extension is incorrectly marked as critical (use a non-NULL critical to override), GNUTLS_E_UNKNOWN_ALGORITHM if the requested OID does not match (e.g., when using GNUTLS_IA_OCSP_URI), otherwise a negative error code.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_key_gn_serial ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_key_gn_serial (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *alt, size_t *alt_size, unsigned int *alt_type, void *serial, size_t *serial_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the X.509 authority key identifier when stored as a general name (authorityCertIssuer) and serial number.
Because more than one general names might be stored seq can be used as a counter to request them all until GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of alt.
holds the type of the alternative name (one of gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t).
buffer to store the serial number (may be null)
Holds the size of the serial field (may be null)
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if the extension is not present, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_key_id (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, void *id, size_t *id_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the X.509v3 certificate authority's key identifier. This is obtained by the X.509 Authority Key identifier extension field (2.5.29.35). Note that this function only returns the keyIdentifier field of the extension and GNUTLS_E_X509_UNSUPPORTED_EXTENSION, if the extension contains the name and serial number of the certificate. In that case gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_key_gn_serial() may be used.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
The place where the identifier will be copied
Holds the size of the id field.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if the extension is not present, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_basic_constraints ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_basic_constraints (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *critical, unsigned int *ca, int *pathlen);
refsect2.para: This function will read the certificate's basic constraints, and return the certificates CA status. It reads the basicConstraints X.509 extension (2.5.29.19).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
pointer to output integer indicating CA status, may be NULL, value is 1 if the certificate CA flag is set, 0 otherwise.
pointer to output integer indicating path length (may be NULL), non-negative error codes indicate a present pathLenConstraint field and the actual value, -1 indicate that the field is absent.

If the certificate is a CA a positive value will be returned, or (0) if the certificate does not have CA flag set. A negative error code may be returned in case of errors. If the certificate does not contain the basicConstraints extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_ca_status ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_ca_status (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return certificates CA status, by reading the basicConstraints X.509 extension (2.5.29.19). If the certificate is a CA a positive value will be returned, or (0) if the certificate does not have CA flag set.
Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_basic_constraints() if you want to read the pathLenConstraint field too.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
A negative error code may be returned in case of parsing error. If the certificate does not contain the basicConstraints extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_crl_dist_points ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_crl_dist_points (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *reason_flags, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function retrieves the CRL distribution points (2.5.29.31), contained in the given certificate in the X509v3 Certificate Extensions.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the distribution point (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the distribution point will be copied to
holds the size of ret.
Revocation reasons. An ORed sequence of flags from gnutls_x509_crl_reason_flags_t.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER and updates ret_size if ret_size is not enough to hold the distribution point, or the type of the distribution point if everything was ok. The type is one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn ()
refsect2.para: This function will copy the name of the Certificate in the provided buffer. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC4514. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the buf_size will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *buf_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the part of the name of the Certificate subject specified by the given OID. The output, if the raw flag is not used, will be encoded as described in RFC4514. Thus a string that is ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h If raw flag is (0), this function will only return known OIDs as text. Other OIDs will be DER encoded, as described in RFC4514 -- in hex format with a '#' prefix. You can check about known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known().
If buf is null then only the size will be filled. If the raw_flag is not specified the output is always null terminated, although the buf_size will not include the null character.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN, this specifies which to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
If non-zero returns the raw DER data of the DN part.
a pointer where the DN part will be copied (may be null).
initially holds the size of buf

GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the buf_size will be updated with the required size. GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if there are no data in the current index. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *oid_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the OIDs of the name of the Certificate subject specified by the given index.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled. The oid returned will be null terminated, although oid_size will not account for the trailing null.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
This specifies which OID to return. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a buffer to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid

GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the buf_size will be updated with the required size. GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if there are no data in the current index. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_expiration_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crt_get_expiration_time (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will return the time this Certificate was or will be expired.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
expiration time, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *oid, int indx, void *buf, size_t *buf_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the extension specified by the OID in the certificate. The extensions will be returned as binary data DER encoded, in the provided buffer.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the extensions, this specifies which to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code is returned. If the certificate does not contain the specified extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_data (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *data, size_t *sizeof_data);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension data in the certificate. The extension data will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_info() to extract the OID and critical flag. Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_by_oid() instead, if you want to get data indexed by the extension OID rather than sequence.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the data (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code is returned. If you have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_info (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *oid_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the certificate, and the critical flag for it. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer. Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_data() to extract the data.

If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then oid_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned. The oid returned will be null terminated, although oid_size will not account for the trailing null.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID
initially holds the maximum size of oid, on return holds actual size of oid.
output variable with critical flag, may be NULL.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code is returned. If you have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *oid_size);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the certificate. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.
The oid returned will be null terminated, although oid_size will not account for the trailing null.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code is returned. If you have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_fingerprint ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_fingerprint (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_digest_algorithm_t algo, void *buf, size_t *buf_size);
refsect2.para: This function will calculate and copy the certificate's fingerprint in the provided buffer.
If the buffer is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
is a digest algorithm
a pointer to a structure to hold the fingerprint (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *buf_size will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_dn_t *dn);
refsect2.para: Return the Certificate's Issuer DN as a gnutls_x509_dn_t data type, that can be decoded using gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava().
Note that dn should be treated as constant. Because it points into the cert object, you should not use dn after cert is deallocated.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
output variable with pointer to uint8_t DN
Returns 0 on success, or an error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_name (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ian, size_t *ian_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function retrieves the Issuer Alternative Name (2.5.29.18), contained in the given certificate in the X509v3 Certificate Extensions.

When the SAN type is otherName, it will extract the data in the otherName's value field, and GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME is returned. You may use gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_othername_oid() to get the corresponding OID and the "virtual" SAN types (e.g., GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_XMPP).

If an otherName OID is known, the data will be decoded. Otherwise the returned data will be DER encoded, and you will have to decode it yourself. Currently, only the RFC 3920 id-on-xmppAddr Issuer AltName is recognized.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of ian.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

the alternative issuer name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ian_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ian_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_name2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_name2 (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ian, size_t *ian_size, unsigned int *ian_type, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the alternative names, contained in the given certificate. It is the same as gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_name() except for the fact that it will return the type of the alternative name in ian_type even if the function fails for some reason (i.e. the buffer provided is not enough).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of ret.
holds the type of the alternative name (one of gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t).
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
