the alternative issuer name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ian_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ian_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_othername_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_othername_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the type OID of an otherName Subject Alternative Name, contained in the given certificate, and return the type as an enumerated element.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled. The oid returned will be null terminated, although oid_size will not account for the trailing null.
This function is only useful if gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_alt_name() returned GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the otherName OID will be copied to
holds the size of ret.

the alternative issuer name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. For supported OIDs, it will return one of the virtual (GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_*) types, e.g. GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_XMPP, and GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME for unknown OIDs. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ret_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ret_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number and with the otherName type then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn ()
refsect2.para: This function will copy the name of the Certificate issuer in the provided buffer. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC4514. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the buf_size will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *buf_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the part of the name of the Certificate issuer specified by the given OID. The output, if the raw flag is not used, will be encoded as described in RFC4514. Thus a string that is ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h If raw flag is (0), this function will only return known OIDs as text. Other OIDs will be DER encoded, as described in RFC4514 -- in hex format with a '#' prefix. You can check about known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known().
If buf is null then only the size will be filled. If the raw_flag is not specified the output is always null terminated, although the buf_size will not include the null character.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN, this specifies which to send. Use (0) to get the first one.
If non-zero returns the raw DER data of the DN part.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf

GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the buf_size will be updated with the required size. GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if there are no data in the current index. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *oid_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the OIDs of the name of the Certificate issuer specified by the given index.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled. The oid returned will be null terminated, although oid_size will not account for the trailing null.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
This specifies which OID to return. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a buffer to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid

GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the buf_size will be updated with the required size. GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if there are no data in the current index. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_unique_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_unique_id (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, char *buf, size_t *buf_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the issuerUniqueID value (if present) for the given certificate.
If the user allocated memory buffer is not large enough to hold the full subjectUniqueID, then a GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER error will be returned, and buf_size will be set to the actual length.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
user allocated memory buffer, will hold the unique id
size of user allocated memory buffer (on input), will hold actual size of the unique ID on return.
GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, otherwise a negative error code.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_id (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int flags, unsigned char *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will return a unique ID that depends on the public key parameters. This ID can be used in checking whether a certificate corresponds to the given private key.

If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned. The output will normally be a SHA-1 hash output, which is 20 bytes.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
should be 0 for now
will contain the key ID
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
In case of failure a negative error code will be returned, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_purpose_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_purpose_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *oid_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the key purpose OIDs of the Certificate specified by the given index. These are stored in the Extended Key Usage extension (2.5.29.37) See the GNUTLS_KP_* definitions for human readable names.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled. The oid returned will be null terminated, although oid_size will not account for the trailing null.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
This specifies which OID to return. Use (0) to get the first one.
a pointer to a buffer to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
output flag to indicate criticality of extension
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *oid_size will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_usage ()
refsect2.para: This function will return certificate's key usage, by reading the keyUsage X.509 extension (2.5.29.15). The key usage value will ORed values of the: GNUTLS_KEY_DIGITAL_SIGNATURE, GNUTLS_KEY_NON_REPUDIATION, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_ENCIPHERMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_DATA_ENCIPHERMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_AGREEMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_CERT_SIGN, GNUTLS_KEY_CRL_SIGN, GNUTLS_KEY_ENCIPHER_ONLY, GNUTLS_KEY_DECIPHER_ONLY.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
where the key usage bits will be stored
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
the certificate key usage, or a negative error code in case of parsing error. If the certificate does not contain the keyUsage extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_algorithm ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_algorithm (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *bits);
refsect2.para: This function will return the public key algorithm of an X.509 certificate.
If bits is non null, it should have enough size to hold the parameters size in bits. For RSA the bits returned is the modulus. For DSA the bits returned are of the public exponent.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
if bits is non null it will hold the size of the parameters' in bits
a member of the gnutls_pk_algorithm_t enumeration on success, or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_dsa_raw ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_dsa_raw (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_datum_t *p, gnutls_datum_t *q, gnutls_datum_t *g, gnutls_datum_t *y);
refsect2.para: This function will export the DSA public key's parameters found in the given certificate. The new parameters will be allocated using gnutls_malloc() and will be stored in the appropriate datum.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
will hold the p
will hold the q
will hold the g
will hold the y
GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, otherwise a negative error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_rsa_raw ()
refsect2.para: This function will export the RSA public key's parameters found in the given structure. The new parameters will be allocated using gnutls_malloc() and will be stored in the appropriate datum.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
will hold the modulus
will hold the public exponent
GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, otherwise a negative error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_policy ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_policy (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, int indx, struct gnutls_x509_policy_st *policy, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the certificate policy (extension 2.5.29.32) specified by the given index.
The policy returned by this function must be deinitialized by using gnutls_x509_policy_release().

listitem.simpara: This specifies which policy to return. Use (0) to get the first one.
A pointer to a policy structure.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if the extension is not present, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.1.5

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_private_key_usage_period ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_private_key_usage_period (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, time_t *activation, time_t *expiration, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the expiration and activation times of the private key of the certificate. It relies on the PKIX extension 2.5.29.16 being present.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
The activation time
The expiration time
the extension status
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if the extension is not present, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_proxy ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_proxy (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *critical, int *pathlen, char **policyLanguage, char **policy, size_t *sizeof_policy);
refsect2.para: This function will get information from a proxy certificate. It reads the ProxyCertInfo X.509 extension (1.3.6.1.5.5.7.1.14).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
pointer to output integer indicating path length (may be NULL), non-negative error codes indicate a present pCPathLenConstraint field and the actual value, -1 indicate that the field is absent.
output variable with OID of policy language
output variable with policy data
output variable size of policy data
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_dn ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_dn (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_datum_t *start);
refsect2.para: This function will return a pointer to the DER encoded DN structure and the length. This points to allocated data that must be free'd using gnutls_free().

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will hold the starting point of the DN
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_issuer_dn ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_issuer_dn (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_datum_t *start);
refsect2.para: This function will return a pointer to the DER encoded DN structure and the length. This points to allocated data that must be free'd using gnutls_free().

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will hold the starting point of the DN
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_serial ()
refsect2.para: This function will return the X.509 certificate's serial number. This is obtained by the X509 Certificate serialNumber field. Serial is not always a 32 or 64bit number. Some CAs use large serial numbers, thus it may be wise to handle it as something uint8_t.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
The place where the serial number will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_signature ()
refsect2.para: This function will extract the signature field of a certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a pointer where the signature part will be copied (may be null).
initially holds the size of sig
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_signature_algorithm ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_signature_algorithm (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will return a value of the gnutls_sign_algorithm_t enumeration that is the signature algorithm that has been used to sign this certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a gnutls_sign_algorithm_t value, or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_dn_t *dn);
refsect2.para: Return the Certificate's Subject DN as a gnutls_x509_dn_t data type, that can be decoded using gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava().
Note that dn should be treated as constant. Because it points into the cert object, you should not use dn after cert is deallocated.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
output variable with pointer to uint8_t DN.
Returns 0 on success, or an error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *san, size_t *san_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function retrieves the Alternative Name (2.5.29.17), contained in the given certificate in the X509v3 Certificate Extensions.

When the SAN type is otherName, it will extract the data in the otherName's value field, and GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME is returned. You may use gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_othername_oid() to get the corresponding OID and the "virtual" SAN types (e.g., GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_XMPP).

If an otherName OID is known, the data will be decoded. Otherwise the returned data will be DER encoded, and you will have to decode it yourself. Currently, only the RFC 3920 id-on-xmppAddr SAN is recognized.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of san.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if san_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case san_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name2 (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *san, size_t *san_size, unsigned int *san_type, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the alternative names, contained in the given certificate. It is the same as gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name() except for the fact that it will return the type of the alternative name in san_type even if the function fails for some reason (i.e. the buffer provided is not enough).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of ret.
holds the type of the alternative name (one of gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t).
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if san_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case san_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_othername_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_othername_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *oid, size_t *oid_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the type OID of an otherName Subject Alternative Name, contained in the given certificate, and return the type as an enumerated element.
This function is only useful if gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name() returned GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled. The oid returned will be null terminated, although oid_size will not account for the trailing null.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the otherName OID will be copied to
holds the size of ret.

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. For supported OIDs, it will return one of the virtual (GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_*) types, e.g. GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_XMPP, and GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME for unknown OIDs. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ian_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ian_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number and with the otherName type then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_key_id (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the X.509v3 certificate's subject key identifier. This is obtained by the X.509 Subject Key identifier extension field (2.5.29.14).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
The place where the identifier will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
will be non-zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE if the extension is not present, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_unique_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_unique_id (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, char *buf, size_t *buf_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the subjectUniqueID value (if present) for the given certificate.
If the user allocated memory buffer is not large enough to hold the full subjectUniqueID, then a GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER error will be returned, and buf_size will be set to the actual length.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
user allocated memory buffer, will hold the unique id
size of user allocated memory buffer (on input), will hold actual size of the unique ID on return.
GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, otherwise a negative error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_version (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
version of certificate, or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_import ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded Certificate to the native gnutls_x509_crt_t format. The output will be stored in cert.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CERTIFICATE", or "CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed certificate.
The DER or PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_init (gnutls_x509_crt_t *cert);
refsect2.para: This function will initialize an X.509 certificate structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_list_import ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_list_import (gnutls_x509_crt_t *certs, unsigned int *cert_max, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given PEM encoded certificate list to the native gnutls_x509_crt_t format. The output will be stored in certs. They will be automatically initialized.

The flag GNUTLS_X509_CRT_LIST_IMPORT_FAIL_IF_EXCEED will cause import to fail if the certificates in the provided buffer are more than the available structures. The GNUTLS_X509_CRT_LIST_FAIL_IF_UNSORTED flag will cause the function to fail if the provided list is not sorted from subject to issuer.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CERTIFICATE", or "CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: The structures to store the parsed certificate. Must not be initialized.
Initially must hold the maximum number of certs. It will be updated with the number of certs available.
The PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM.
must be (0) or an OR'd sequence of gnutls_certificate_import_flags.
the number of certificates read or a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_list_import2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_list_import2 (gnutls_x509_crt_t **certs, unsigned int *size, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given PEM encoded certificate list to the native gnutls_x509_crt_t format. The output will be stored in certs which will be initialized.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CERTIFICATE", or "CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: The structures to store the parsed certificate. Must not be initialized.
It will contain the size of the list.
The PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM.
must be (0) or an OR'd sequence of gnutls_certificate_import_flags.
the number of certificates read or a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_list_verify ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_list_verify (const gnutls_x509_crt_t *cert_list, int cert_list_length, const gnutls_x509_crt_t *CA_list, int CA_list_length, const gnutls_x509_crl_t *CRL_list, int CRL_list_length, unsigned int flags, unsigned int *verify);
refsect2.para: This function will try to verify the given certificate list and return its status. If no flags are specified (0), this function will use the basicConstraints (2.5.29.19) PKIX extension. This means that only a certificate authority is allowed to sign a certificate.
You must also check the peer's name in order to check if the verified certificate belongs to the actual peer.

The certificate verification output will be put in verify and will be one or more of the gnutls_certificate_status_t enumerated elements bitwise or'd. For a more detailed verification status use gnutls_x509_crt_verify() per list element.

listitem.simpara: is the certificate list to be verified
holds the number of certificate in cert_list
is the CA list which will be used in verification
holds the number of CA certificate in CA_list
holds a list of CRLs.
the length of CRL list.
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
will hold the certificate verification output.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_print ()
refsect2.para: This function will pretty print a X.509 certificate, suitable for display to a human.

If the format is GNUTLS_CRT_PRINT_FULL then all fields of the certificate will be output, on multiple lines. The GNUTLS_CRT_PRINT_ONELINE format will generate one line with some selected fields, which is useful for logging purposes.
The output out needs to be deallocated using gnutls_free().

listitem.simpara: The structure to be printed
Indicate the format to use
Newly allocated datum with (0) terminated string.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_activation_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_activation_time (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, time_t act_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set the time this Certificate was or will be activated.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_authority_info_access ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_authority_info_access (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, int what, gnutls_datum_t *data);
refsect2.para: This function sets the Authority Information Access (AIA) extension, see RFC 5280 section 4.2.2.1 for more information.
The type of data stored in data is specified via what which should be gnutls_info_access_what_t values.
If what is GNUTLS_IA_OCSP_URI, data will hold the OCSP URI. If what is GNUTLS_IA_CAISSUERS_URI, data will hold the caIssuers URI.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
what data to get, a gnutls_info_access_what_t type.
output data to be freed with gnutls_free().
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

The key ID

true(1) or false(0). Depending on the Certificate authority status.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, const char *oid, unsigned int raw_flag, const void *name, unsigned int sizeof_name);
refsect2.para: This function will set the part of the name of the Certificate subject, specified by the given OID. The input string should be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h With this function you can only set the known OIDs. You can test for known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known(). For OIDs that are not known (by gnutls) you should properly DER encode your data, and call this function with raw_flag set.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
holds an Object Identifier in a null terminated string
must be 0, or 1 if the data are DER encoded
a pointer to the name
holds the size of name
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_issuer_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, const char *oid, unsigned int raw_flag, const void *name, unsigned int sizeof_name);
refsect2.para: This function will set the part of the name of the Certificate issuer, specified by the given OID. The input string should be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h With this function you can only set the known OIDs. You can test for known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known(). For OIDs that are not known (by gnutls) you should properly DER encode your data, and call this function with raw_flag set.
Normally you do not need to call this function, since the signing operation will copy the signer's name as the issuer of the certificate.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
holds an Object Identifier in a null terminated string
must be 0, or 1 if the data are DER encoded
a pointer to the name
holds the size of name
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: This function will set the key purpose OIDs of the Certificate. These are stored in the Extended Key Usage extension (2.5.29.37) See the GNUTLS_KP_* definitions for human readable names.
Subsequent calls to this function will append OIDs to the OID list.

a pointer to a null terminated string that holds the OID
Whether this extension will be critical or not
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error code is returned.

an ORed sequence of the GNUTLS_KEY_* elements.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_pin_function ()
refsect2.para: This function will set a callback function to be used when it is required to access a protected object. This function overrides the global function set using gnutls_pkcs11_set_pin_function().
Note that this callback is currently used only during the import of a PKCS 11 certificate with gnutls_x509_crt_import_pkcs11_url().

data associated with the callback

Note the maximum text size for the qualifier GNUTLS_X509_QUALIFIER_NOTICE is 200 characters. This function will fail with GNUTLS_E_INVALID_REQUEST if this is exceeded.

use non-zero if the extension is marked as critical
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

This corresponds to the required proxy certificate naming style. Note that if name is NULL, you MUST set it later by using gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid() or similar.

refsect2.para: This function will set the X.509 certificate's serial number. Serial is not always a 32 or 64bit number. Some CAs use large serial numbers, thus it may be wise to handle it as something uint8_t.

GNUTLS_SAN_DNSNAME: as a text string
GNUTLS_SAN_RFC822NAME: as a text string
GNUTLS_SAN_URI: as a text string
GNUTLS_SAN_IPADDRESS: as a binary IP address (4 or 16 bytes)
Other values can be set as binary values with the proper DER encoding.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_version (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int version);
refsect2.para: This function will set the version of the certificate. This must be one for X.509 version 1, and so on. Plain certificates without extensions must have version set to one.

To create well-formed certificates, you must specify version 3 if you use any certificate extensions. Extensions are created by functions such as gnutls_x509_crt_set_subject_alt_name() or gnutls_x509_crt_set_key_usage().

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_dn_deinit (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn);
refsect2.para: This function deallocates the DN object as returned by gnutls_x509_dn_import().

listitem.simpara: a DN uint8_t object pointer.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_export (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the DN to DER or PEM format.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN NAME".

listitem.simpara: Holds the uint8_t DN object
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a DN PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_export2 ()
refsect2.para: This function will export the DN to DER or PEM format.
The output buffer is allocated using gnutls_malloc().
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN NAME".

listitem.simpara: Holds the uint8_t DN object
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a DN PEM or DER encoded
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn, int irdn, int iava, gnutls_x509_ava_st *ava);
refsect2.para: Get pointers to data within the DN. The format of the ava structure is shown below.
The X.509 distinguished name is a sequence of sequences of strings and this is what the irdn and iava indexes model.

Note that ava will contain pointers into the dn structure, so you should not modify any data or deallocate it. Note also that the DN in turn points into the original certificate structure, and thus you may not deallocate the certificate and continue to access dn.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to DN
index of RDN
index of AVA.
Pointer to structure which will hold output information.
Returns 0 on success, or an error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_import ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_import (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn, const gnutls_datum_t *data);
refsect2.para: This function parses an RDN sequence and stores the result to a gnutls_x509_dn_t structure. The structure must have been initialized with gnutls_x509_dn_init(). You may use gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava() to decode the DN.

listitem.simpara: the structure that will hold the imported DN
should contain a DER encoded RDN sequence
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_init (gnutls_x509_dn_t *dn);
refsect2.para: This function initializes a gnutls_x509_dn_t structure.
The object returned must be deallocated using gnutls_x509_dn_deinit().

listitem.simpara: the object to be initialized
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known (const char *oid);
refsect2.para: This function will inform about known DN OIDs. This is useful since functions like gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid() use the information on known OIDs to properly encode their input. Object Identifiers that are not known are not encoded by these functions, and their input is stored directly into the ASN.1 structure. In that case of unknown OIDs, you have the responsibility of DER encoding your data.

listitem.simpara: holds an Object Identifier in a null terminated string
1 on known OIDs and 0 otherwise.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_oid_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: const char * gnutls_x509_dn_oid_name (const char *oid, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will return the name of a known DN OID. If GNUTLS_X509_DN_OID_RETURN_OID is specified this function will return the given OID if no descriptive name has been found.

listitem.simpara: holds an Object Identifier in a null terminated string
0 or GNUTLS_X509_DN_OID_*
A null terminated string or NULL otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_t
refsect2.programlisting: typedef void *gnutls_x509_dn_t;

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_policy_release ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_policy_release (struct gnutls_x509_policy_st *policy);
refsect2.para: This function will deinitialize all memory associated with the provided policy. The policy is allocated using gnutls_x509_crt_get_policy().

The source key

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_privkey_export (gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the private key to a PKCS1 structure for RSA keys, or an integer sequence for DSA keys. The DSA keys are in the same format with the parameters used by openssl.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY".

listitem.simpara: Holds the key
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a private key PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_export2 ()
refsect2.para: This function will export the private key to a PKCS1 structure for RSA keys, or an integer sequence for DSA keys. The DSA keys are in the same format with the parameters used by openssl.
The output buffer is allocated using gnutls_malloc().
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY".

listitem.simpara: Holds the key
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a private key PEM or DER encoded
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value. Since 3.1.3

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_export2_pkcs8 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_privkey_export2_pkcs8 (gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, const char *password, unsigned int flags, gnutls_datum_t *out);
refsect2.para: This function will export the private key to a PKCS8 structure. Both RSA and DSA keys can be exported. For DSA keys we use PKCS 11 definitions. If the flags do not specify the encryption cipher, then the default 3DES (PBES2) will be used.
The password can be either ASCII or UTF-8 in the default PBES2 encryption schemas, or ASCII for the PKCS12 schemas.
The output buffer is allocated using gnutls_malloc().
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY" or "BEGIN PRIVATE KEY" if encryption is not used.

listitem.simpara: Holds the key
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
the password that will be used to encrypt the key.
an ORed sequence of gnutls_pkcs_encrypt_flags_t
will contain a private key PEM or DER encoded
In case of failure a negative error code will be returned, and 0 on success. Since 3.1.3

will hold the x

If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY" or "BEGIN PRIVATE KEY" if encryption is not used.

the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
the password that will be used to encrypt the key.
an ORed sequence of gnutls_pkcs_encrypt_flags_t
will contain a private key PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
In case of failure a negative error code will be returned, and 0 on success.

refsect2.para: This function will generate a random private key. Note that this function must be called on an empty private key.
Do not set the number of bits directly, use gnutls_sec_param_to_pk_bits().

the size of the modulus

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_get_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_privkey_get_key_id (gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, unsigned int flags, unsigned char *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will return a unique ID that depends on the public key parameters. This ID can be used in checking whether a certificate corresponds to the given key.

If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned. The output will normally be a SHA-1 hash output, which is 20 bytes.

listitem.simpara: Holds the key
should be 0 for now
will contain the key ID
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

a member of the gnutls_pk_algorithm_t enumeration on success, or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_import ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded key to the native gnutls_x509_privkey_t format. The output will be stored in key .
If the key is PEM encoded it should have a header that contains "PRIVATE KEY". Note that this function falls back to PKCS #8 decoding without password, if the default format fails to import.

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed key
The DER or PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_import2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_privkey_import2 (gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, const char *password, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will import the given DER or PEM encoded key, to the native gnutls_x509_privkey_t format, irrespective of the input format. The input format is auto-detected.
The supported formats are typical X.509, PKCS #8 and the openssl format.
If the provided key is encrypted but no password was given, then GNUTLS_E_DECRYPTION_FAILED is returned.

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed key
The DER or PEM encoded key.
One of DER or PEM
A password (optional)
an ORed sequence of gnutls_pkcs_encrypt_flags_t
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_import_openssl ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given PEM encrypted to the native gnutls_x509_privkey_t format. The output will be stored in key.
The password should be in ASCII. If the password is not provided or wrong then GNUTLS_E_DECRYPTION_FAILED will be returned.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "PRIVATE KEY" and the "DEK-Info" header.

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed key
The DER or PEM encoded key.
the password to decrypt the key (if it is encrypted).
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_import_pkcs8 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_privkey_import_pkcs8 (gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, const char *password, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded PKCS8 2.0 encrypted key to the native gnutls_x509_privkey_t format. The output will be stored in key. Both RSA and DSA keys can be imported, and flags can only be used to indicate an unencrypted key.
The password can be either ASCII or UTF-8 in the default PBES2 encryption schemas, or ASCII for the PKCS12 schemas.

If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY", or "PRIVATE KEY". You only need to specify the flags if the key is DER encoded, since in that case the encryption status cannot be auto-detected.
If the GNUTLS_PKCS_PLAIN flag is specified and the supplied data are encrypted then GNUTLS_E_DECRYPTION_FAILED is returned.

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed key
The DER or PEM encoded key.
One of DER or PEM
the password to decrypt the key (if it is encrypted).
0 if encrypted or GNUTLS_PKCS_PLAIN if not encrypted.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_rdn_get ()
refsect2.para: This function will return the name of the given RDN sequence. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC4514.

listitem.simpara: should contain a DER encoded RDN sequence
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name
holds the size of buf
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, or GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned and *sizeof_buf is updated if the provided buffer is not long enough, otherwise a negative error value.

listitem.simpara: should contain a DER encoded RDN sequence
an Object Identifier
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN indicates which to send. Use 0 for the first one.
If non-zero then the raw DER data are returned.
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name
holds the size of buf
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, or GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned and *sizeof_buf is updated if the provided buffer is not long enough, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_cas ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_cas (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, const gnutls_x509_crt_t *clist, int clist_size, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will add the given certificate authorities to the trusted list. The list of CAs must not be deinitialized during this structure's lifetime.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
A list of CAs
The length of the CA list
should be 0.
The number of added elements is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_crls ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_crls (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, const gnutls_x509_crl_t *crl_list, int crl_size, unsigned int flags, unsigned int verification_flags);
refsect2.para: This function will add the given certificate revocation lists to the trusted list. The list of CRLs must not be deinitialized during this structure's lifetime.
This function must be called after gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_cas() to allow verifying the CRLs for validity.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
A list of CRLs
The length of the CRL list
if GNUTLS_TL_VERIFY_CRL is given the CRLs will be verified before being added.
gnutls_certificate_verify_flags if flags specifies GNUTLS_TL_VERIFY_CRL
The number of added elements is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_named_crt ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_named_crt (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const void *name, size_t name_size, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will add the given certificate to the trusted list and associate it with a name. The certificate will not be be used for verification with gnutls_x509_trust_list_verify_crt() but only with gnutls_x509_trust_list_verify_named_crt().
In principle this function can be used to set individual "server" certificates that are trusted by the user for that specific server but for no other purposes.
The certificate must not be deinitialized during the lifetime of the trusted list.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
A certificate
An identifier for the certificate
The size of the identifier
should be 0.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_system_trust ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_system_trust (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, unsigned int tl_flags, unsigned int tl_vflags);
refsect2.para: This function adds the system's default trusted certificate authorities to the trusted list. Note that on unsupported system this function returns GNUTLS_E_UNIMPLEMENTED_FEATURE.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
GNUTLS_TL_*
gnutls_certificate_verify_flags if flags specifies GNUTLS_TL_VERIFY_CRL
The number of added elements or a negative error code on error.

refsect2.para: Since 3.1

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_trust_file ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_trust_file (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, const char *ca_file, const char *crl_file, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t type, unsigned int tl_flags, unsigned int tl_vflags);
refsect2.para: This function will add the given certificate authorities to the trusted list. pkcs11 URLs are also accepted, instead of files, by this function.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
A file containing a list of CAs (optional)
A file containing a list of CRLs (optional)
The format of the certificates
GNUTLS_TL_*
gnutls_certificate_verify_flags if flags specifies GNUTLS_TL_VERIFY_CRL
The number of added elements is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 3.1

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_trust_mem ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_trust_mem (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, const gnutls_datum_t *cas, const gnutls_datum_t *crls, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t type, unsigned int tl_flags, unsigned int tl_vflags);
refsect2.para: This function will add the given certificate authorities to the trusted list.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
A buffer containing a list of CAs (optional)
A buffer containing a list of CRLs (optional)
The format of the certificates
GNUTLS_TL_*
gnutls_certificate_verify_flags if flags specifies GNUTLS_TL_VERIFY_CRL
The number of added elements is returned.

refsect2.para: Since 3.1

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_trust_list_deinit (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, unsigned int all);
refsect2.para: This function will deinitialize a trust list.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be deinitialized
if non-(0) it will deinitialize all the certificates and CRLs contained in the structure.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_get_issuer ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_get_issuer (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_crt_t *issuer, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will attempt to find the issuer of the given certificate.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
is the certificate to find issuer for
Will hold the issuer if any. Should be treated as constant.
Use (0).
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_init (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t *list, unsigned int size);
refsect2.para: This function will initialize an X.509 trust list structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized
The size of the internal hash table. Use (0) for default size.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_t
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct gnutls_x509_trust_list_st *gnutls_x509_trust_list_t;

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_verify_crt ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_verify_crt (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, gnutls_x509_crt_t *cert_list, unsigned int cert_list_size, unsigned int flags, unsigned int *verify, gnutls_verify_output_function func);
refsect2.para: This function will try to verify the given certificate and return its status. The verify parameter will hold an OR'ed sequence of gnutls_certificate_status_t flags.
Limitation: Pathlen constraints or key usage flags are not consulted.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
is the certificate list to be verified
is the certificate list size
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
will hold the certificate verification output.
If non-null will be called on each chain element verification with the output.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_trust_list_verify_named_crt ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_trust_list_verify_named_crt (gnutls_x509_trust_list_t list, gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const void *name, size_t name_size, unsigned int flags, unsigned int *verify, gnutls_verify_output_function func);
refsect2.para: This function will try to find a certificate that is associated with the provided name --see gnutls_x509_trust_list_add_named_crt(). If a match is found the certificate is considered valid. In addition to that this function will also check CRLs. The verify parameter will hold an OR'ed sequence of gnutls_certificate_status_t flags.

listitem.simpara: The structure of the list
is the certificate to be verified
is the certificate's name
is the certificate's name size
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
will hold the certificate verification output.
If non-null will be called on each chain element verification with the output.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (0) is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 3.0
